me.fluxcapacitor.dragongamecore

Class Queue

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.fluxcapacitor.dragongamecore.Queue

  • public class Queue
extends java.lang.Object
    A queue for a game, which is map-specific.
    Author:
    FluxCapacitor
    See Also:
    GameMap, DragonGame

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • START_REQUIREMENT

        final int START_REQUIREMENT
        The number of players required to start

      • MAX_PLAYERS_PER_LOBBY

        final int MAX_PLAYERS_PER_LOBBY
        The maximum players allowed in the game.

      • COUNTDOWN_TIME

        private final int COUNTDOWN_TIME
        The time it takes for the game to start after the timer starts. Typically is 30. Measured in seconds.
        See Also:
        CountdownTimer

      • map

        private final GameMap map
        The map that this Queue is assigned.
        See Also:
        GameMap

      • game

        private final DragonGame game
        The game that this Queue is assigned.
        See Also:
        DragonGame

      • gameLifecycle

        private final GameLifecycle gameLifecycle
        The "lifecycle" class with game-specific methods that run at key points in the game.
        See Also:
        GameLifecycle

      • gameStartSubtitle

        private final java.lang.String gameStartSubtitle
        The subtitle that all players see under the "GO" title. This is shown when the game starts.

      • queue

        public java.util.ArrayList<org.bukkit.entity.Player> queue
        A list of all queued players.

      • teams

        public java.util.ArrayList<Team> teams
        A list of all teams ingame.

      • timerStarted

        public boolean timerStarted
        Shows if the timer has started. If the game has started, this is still true.

      • gameStarted

        public boolean gameStarted
        Reflects if the game has started. Resets in resetVariables().

      • spectators

        public java.util.ArrayList<org.bukkit.entity.Player> spectators
        A list of all spectators.

      • timer

        CountdownTimer timer
        The countdown timer used for starting the game.
        See Also:
        CountdownTimer

      • canDeclareWinner

        boolean canDeclareWinner
        Reflects if the game is allowed to declare a winner. If this is false, there will never be a winner until it is set to true (which happens when the game starts).

      • isInPrivate

        boolean isInPrivate
        Shows if the game is currently being played by a party in private mode.

      • privateParty

        Party privateParty
        If isInPrivate is true, this will be the party that is privately playing.
        See Also:
        Party

    • Constructor Detail

      • Queue

        Queue(DragonGame game,
      GameMap map,
      int countdownTime,
      int maxPlayers,
      int startRequirement)
        Create a new Queue
        Parameters:
        game - The game that this queue is running
        map - The map that the queue is being created for
        countdownTime - The time that it takes to start the game. (Typically 30 seconds)
        maxPlayers - The maximum players in the game
        startRequirement - The number of players required to start a game. Must be at least 2.
        See Also:
        DragonGame, GameMap, COUNTDOWN_TIME, MAX_PLAYERS_PER_LOBBY, START_REQUIREMENT

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Add a player to the queue for a game.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to add to the queue

      • addInternal

        private void addInternal(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Add a player to the Queue.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to add to the queue.

      • addInternal

        private void addInternal(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                         boolean isPriority)
        This is the main method for adding a player to a game. All overloaded methods called addInternal or add eventually call this method after handling parties and other complications.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to add to the game
        isPriority - If the player has permission for priority queue

      • updateQueue

        private void updateQueue()
        Update the queue and start the timer if necessary.

      • getNonPrivatePlayerCount

        private int getNonPrivatePlayerCount()
        Get the count of players that are not in private parties.
        Returns:
        The count of players that are not in a private party.

      • addInternal

        private void addInternal(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                         boolean isPriority,
                         boolean isPrivate)
        Add a player to the queue
        Parameters:
        player - The player to add to the queue
        isPriority - If the player has priority queue
        isPrivate - If the player is joining in private

      • getWorldName

        java.lang.String getWorldName()
        Get the name of the world that the map is in.
        Returns:
        The world name

      • preGame

        private void preGame()
        When the timer starts, this method is triggered. It resets the map and other related things.

      • getPrivatePartyIndex

        private int getPrivatePartyIndex()
        Get the index of a private party in the queue. If the returned value is 0, then a private party is first in the queue.
        Returns:
        The index of the first private party in the queue

      • pregamePerPlayer

        private void pregamePerPlayer(DragonGame game,
                              GameMap map,
                              org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        This is like the pregame method, but it is called per-player.
        Parameters:
        game - The game that the player is playing
        map - The map that the player is playing on
        player - The player to use within the method

      • getSpawnPoint

        private org.bukkit.Location getSpawnPoint(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Get the team-specific spawn point of the map
        Parameters:
        player - The player to use to find a spawn point
        Returns:
        A Location that is a player's spawn point (which is team specific)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Convert this class to a String
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A human-readable String that represents this class

      • startGame

        private void startGame()
        Start the game. This method balances teams, removes friendly fire, turns off invincibility, etc.

      • balanceTeams

        private void balanceTeams()
        This method balances teams. If one team (x) has 2 more players than another (y), then y will take one player from x.

      • countDown

        private void countDown(CountdownTimer timer)
        This method is called every second (or every time the timer runs)
        Parameters:
        timer - The timer used for determining how many seconds are left.

      • setupNextGame

        void setupNextGame()
        Setup the next game. If there are enough people in queue, then start the next game!

      • startTimer

        private void startTimer()
        Start the timer. This also sets timerStarted to true and calls the game-specific onTimerStart and onTimerStartPerPlayer methods.

      • newTimer

        private CountdownTimer newTimer()
        Create a new timer
        Returns:
        A new timer object to use in starting the game

      • resetVariables

        public void resetVariables()
        Reset most variables associated with this Queue. This includes gameStarted, timerStarted, and timer.

      • resetIngame

        public void resetIngame()
        Reset all ingame players and spectators. Mostly used in conjunction with resetVariables()
        See Also:
        resetVariables()

      • resetQueue

        public void resetQueue()
        Reset all queued players. Mostly used in conjunction with resetVariables()
        See Also:
        resetVariables()

      • getTeams

        public java.util.ArrayList<Team> getTeams()
        Get all teams in the game
        Returns:
        All teams in the game

      • addTeam

        private void addTeam(Team team)
        Add a team to the game
        Parameters:
        team - The team to add

      • removeAllTeams

        private void removeAllTeams()
        Reset all teams
        See Also:
        resetVariables()

      • getTeamCountWithPlayers

        public int getTeamCountWithPlayers()
        Get the number of teams with players on them
        Returns:
        The count of all teams with at least 1 player on them

      • getPlayerCount

        public int getPlayerCount()
        Get the number of players in the game.
        Returns:
        Total ingame player count.

      • declareWinner

        @Deprecated
public void declareWinner(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Deprecated. 
        Declare a winner
        Parameters:
        player - The winner

      • removePlayerFromTeams

        public void removePlayerFromTeams(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Remove a player from ALL of their team(s).
        Parameters:
        player - The player to remove from their team(s).
